generators.name: Grammatical Evolution (GE) Generator
generators.description: Evolutionary generator using design grammars: levels are encoded as grammar-expansion instructions; fitness favors many placed items while minimizing placement conflicts. (Mapped to the GE generator described in the FDG2014 comparative evaluation.)

generators.name: Hopper Level Generator
generators.description: Constructive left-to-right generator placing features with probabilities; designed for adaptivity so probabilities can change based on player performance; alternates generated parts with pre-designed parts.

generators.name: Notch (Infinite Mario Bros) Generator
generators.description: Default Infinite Mario Bros generator: writes levels left-to-right by placing components according to probabilities, with basic playability checks.

generators.name: Parameterized Notch Generator
generators.description: Parameterized variant of the Notch generator. Parameters bias generation such as number/width of gaps, enemies and their placement, powerups, and boxes (often explored via combinations of high/low settings).

generators.name: Parameterized Notch (Randomized Params) Generator
generators.description: Same as Parameterized Notch, but parameter values are chosen at random (a randomized parameter configuration set).

generators.name: Occupancy-Regulated Extension (ORE) Generator
generators.description: Chunk-based generator that assembles small hand-authored level pieces using anchor points to determine how chunks connect; can produce complex levels stylistically different from original Mario.

generators.name: Original Super Mario Bros (SMB1) Levels
generators.description: Hand-authored levels from Super Mario Bros (1985), transcribed into the benchmarkâ€™s representation as faithfully as possible (excluding unsupported elements such as water levels in that framework).

generators.name: Pattern-based Generator (Pattern Count Fitness)
generators.description: Evolutionary pattern-based generator: represents a level as a sequence of 1-tile-wide slices (micro-patterns) taken from original Mario; fitness counts each occurrence of specified meso-patterns (counting repeats).

generators.name: Pattern-based Generator (Pattern Occurrence Fitness)
generators.description: Pattern-based evolutionary generator variant where fitness rewards unique meso-pattern occurrence (counts each meso-pattern at most once, emphasizing diversity over repetition).

generators.name: Pattern-based Generator (Weighted Pattern Count Fitness)
generators.description: Pattern-based evolutionary generator variant where meso-pattern counts are weighted by rarity, rewarding inclusion of rarer patterns more strongly than common ones.

generators.name: MarioGPT (Text2Level via GPT-2)
generators.description: LLM-based, text-promptable level generator for Super Mario Bros. Uses a fine-tuned GPT-2 (distilgpt2) to generate tile-based levels from short natural-language prompts; designed for controllable generation and diversity (paper: NeurIPS 2023). Reference implementation: https://github.com/shyamsn97/mario-gpt
